result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Andrew A. Sutherland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:

Comply with rules set out by the Department of Health and Human Services.

Engage in, pay for, and successfully complete any counseling ordered by the agent.

Pay court costs and costs of supervision.  Included in the court costs are the DNA and domestic abuse surcharges that have been imposed by the Court.

(The Defendant has a 12-month diversion agreement with the DA on Count 1.  During the term of that agreement, his signature bond remains in effect.  All but the standard bond conditions have been removed.)

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew A. Sutherland

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
DA Harper, Def, and Atty. McDougal.  Atty. M states that the parties have reached an agreement and wish to proceed to plea/sentencing.  Per McDougal, the State has filed an amended information containing two counts, including one count of physical abuse of child (class I felony) and one count of misdemeanor battery with a dom. abuse enhancer.  The joint recommendation of the parties being presented to the Court calls for def to plea to both counts for diversion agreement on count 1 and 2 years probation on count 2 with terms that he require with requirements of HHS.

Defense waives formal reading of the amended information.  Court states the charges and informs def of the possible max. penalties.  Def pleads no contest to both charges contained in the amended information.  Court's colloquy re plea.  Finding of guilty on both counts.

Court follows the jt recommendation and orders a diversion agreement of 12 months on Count 1/the felony.  Court orders sentence withheld for 2 years probation.  Conditions:  comply with rules set out by Department of HHS and that he engage in, successfully complete, and pay for any counseling ordered by agent; pay costs of action.  DNA and dom. abuse surcharge imposed on the misdemeanor.

Atty. M asks that conditions of def's signature bond be only the standard ones.  So ordered.

DA Harper, Def, and Atty. McDougal.  Today was to be the date for the prelim.  Atty. M advises that the def wishes to waive his right to prelim.  Court's colloquy with def re waiver of prelim.  Def boundover and arraignment set.  Arraignment scheduled for 08-06-2014 at 03:30 pm.

Bond amended 5-21-14:  Provision re no contact with the residence is eliminated.  Def is allowed to have supervised contact with the children but the supervisor must be someone other than their mother.
Preliminary hearing on June 18, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

DA Harper, Def, and Atty. McDougal.  Formal reading waived.  Court states the charge and informs def of the possible max. penalties.  Court informs def of his rights including right to prelim.  Atty. M states def will waive rights to prelim time limits but preserves def's right to have a prelim at a later date.  Prelim set for June 18 at 2:30.

Atty. M makes request for bond modification; asks that supervised contact be allowed with the child and that "no contact with the residence" be lifted.  ADA Forehand doesn't object to the no contact with the residence part but wants the supervised contact to be as arranged by the department.  No objection by Atty. M to that request.

Revised bond to read:  Provision re no contact with the residence is eliminated.  Def is allowed to have supervised contact with the children but the supervisor must be someone other than their mother.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 06-18-2014 at 02:30 pm.
